abstract.text: An object that provides a default search view within a macOS Today widget.

platforms.message: Use WidgetKit instead. Today View extensions have been deprecated.
platforms.name: macOS

inlineContent.text: class provides a default search view within a Today widget. A search view controller works together with its delegate to perform searches on the user’s input and display results from which a user can choose. To learn about the search view controller delegate methods, see
When a widget is in editing mode, it can enable search for new content by instantiating an
. The search view controller displays the default search field and a list of results. It uses its

abstract.text: Extend the reach of your app by creating widgets, watch complications, Live Activities, and controls.
Create and manage widgets for the Today view.
An object that provides a default search view within a macOS Today widget.
The search view controller’s delegate or
if the receiver doesn’t have a delegate.
A localized description of the nature of the search.
A key path for the string property to display for each object in the search results array.
An array of search results.
A localized phrase displayed in the results list when no search results are available.
The interface for enabling user searches in the search view controller of a macOS Today widget.
A controller that manages a view, typically loaded from a nib file.
A protocol that enables an object to be encoded and decoded for archiving and distribution.
The interface an app extension uses to respond to a request from a host app.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A set of methods that support the mediation of a custom segue.
Methods that responder subclasses implement to support key binding commands, such as inserting tabs and newlines, or moving the insertion point.
A protocol that an object adopts to create a bar object in your app.
A protocol that marks classes to restore the state of your app to continue a user activity.
A set of methods used to associate a unique identifier with objects in your user interface.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A singleton actor whose executor is equivalent to the main dispatch queue.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
A thread-safe type whose values can be shared across arbitrary concurrent contexts without introducing a risk of data races.
